trans-unit.source: How to get started with Azure Mobile Services in a Visual Studio .NET project
trans-unit.target: How to get started with Azure Mobile Services in a Visual Studio .NET project

trans-unit.source: The first step you need to do in order to follow the code in these examples depends on what type of mobile service you connected to.
trans-unit.target: The first step you need to do in order to follow the code in these examples depends on what type of mobile service you connected to.

trans-unit.source: For a JavaScript backend mobile service, create a table called TodoItem.
trans-unit.target: For a JavaScript backend mobile service, create a table called TodoItem.

trans-unit.source: To create a table, locate the mobile service under the Azure node in Server Explorer, right-click the mobile service's node to open the context menu, and choose Create Table.
trans-unit.target: To create a table, locate the mobile service under the Azure node in Server Explorer, right-click the mobile service's node to open the context menu, and choose Create Table.

trans-unit.source: Enter "TodoItem" as the table name.
trans-unit.target: Enter "TodoItem" as the table name.

trans-unit.source: If you have a .NET backend mobile service, there's already a TodoItem table in the default project template that Visual Studio created for you, but you need to publish it to Azure.
trans-unit.target: If you have a .NET backend mobile service, there's already a TodoItem table in the default project template that Visual Studio created for you, but you need to publish it to Azure.

trans-unit.source: To publish it, open the context menu for the mobile service project in Solution Explorer, and choose Publish Web.
trans-unit.target: To publish it, open the context menu for the mobile service project in Solution Explorer, and choose Publish Web.

trans-unit.source: Accept the defaults, and choose the Publish button.
trans-unit.target: Accept the defaults, and choose the Publish button.

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a reference to a table (todoTable) that contains data for a TodoItem, which you can use in subsequent operations to read and update the data table.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a reference to a table (todoTable) that contains data for a TodoItem, which you can use in subsequent operations to read and update the data table.

trans-unit.source: You'll need the TodoItem class with attributes set up to interpet the JSON that the mobile service sends in response to your queries.
trans-unit.target: You'll need the TodoItem class with attributes set up to interpet the JSON that the mobile service sends in response to your queries.

trans-unit.source: This code works if your table has permissions set to Anybody with an Application Key.
trans-unit.target: This code works if your table has permissions set to Anybody with an Application Key.

trans-unit.source: If you change the permissions to secure your mobile service, you'll need to add user authentication support.
trans-unit.target: If you change the permissions to secure your mobile service, you'll need to add user authentication support.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Started with Authentication</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Started with Authentication</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Insert a new item into a data table.
trans-unit.target: Insert a new item into a data table.

trans-unit.source: The following code queries a table for all items.
trans-unit.target: The following code queries a table for all items.

trans-unit.source: Note that it returns only the first page of data, which by default is 50 items.
trans-unit.target: Note that it returns only the first page of data, which by default is 50 items.

trans-unit.source: You can pass the page size you want, since it's an optional parameter.
trans-unit.target: You can pass the page size you want, since it's an optional parameter.

trans-unit.source: Update a row in a data table.
trans-unit.target: Update a row in a data table.

trans-unit.source: The parameter item is the TodoItem object to be updated.
trans-unit.target: The parameter item is the TodoItem object to be updated.

trans-unit.source: Delete a row in the database.
trans-unit.target: Delete a row in the database.

trans-unit.source: The parameter item is the TodoItem object to be deleted.
trans-unit.target: The parameter item is the TodoItem object to be deleted.
